reason: Conflicting signals from growing institutional interest (State Street) and strong altcoin demand (Ethereum staking backlog) are offset by a major security breach ($282M hack) and significant regulatory uncertainty (Senate crypto bill reboot). This creates a highly volatile environment where smart money may be accumulating, but retail investors face heightened risks. Caution is advised as the market digests these divergent forces.
headlines: State Street, a $36 billion bank, is aiming to change legacy finance using blockchain tech
Hacker steals $282 million crypto in hardware wallet social-engineering attack
Tom Lee's BitMine pushes Ethereum into $8 billion staking backlog
Senate Democrats serious about crypto bill reboot, they said in call with industry
Polygon Labs said to have laid off 60 staff following new $250 million acquisition
